poem:
Title: "The Bargain Mirage"

In aisles stripped bare where hurry stalks,
Turned thrifty eye towards larger box.
But in the kingdom of commerce lies
Savings, foolish pretexts in disguise. 
Toilet roll, cheese, soap pods too,
Supermarket giants mockingly view. 
Baited trust on marked down price,
The better deal a rolling dice.
Alas, the shopper bears the cost,
In the maze of markets, we remain lost.
